page.title: 13Natural History,Abermorddu
page.content: The varied geology of the area with its hills and valleys, allows for a rich local{ecology}. The{landscape}is dominated by{farmland}and{woodland,} which contain a great variety of wild plants and wildlife. Most types of indigenous hawks and owls are present, whilst along the banks of the{River Cegidog}and{River {Alyn} many pond and river birds can be seen. In the vicinity of the local villages and hillside farms all the common British birds can be found. Locals interested in {natural history} report that most smaller mammals are present and that in the summer months, bats,frogs,toads and lizards can be observed. The local rivers and ponds contain many common ,inedible ,freshwater fish as well as being stocked with trout for the local{angling}clubs.
